plugins.name: Annotation Toolkit
plugins.description:
Welcome to Annotation Toolkit!


This Figma plugin helps you easily add various annotations like cursors, labels, and connectors to your designs. Most importantly, all elements are created within a single group, allowing for easy management and keeping your design files tidy.
plugins.tagline: Add various annotations like labels and connectors, all in one annotation layer

plugins.name: Token Exporter Pro
plugins.description:
Export Figma color, gradient, and shadow tokens with one click ‚Äî no fluff, just clean, dev-ready output.


Choose your naming convention (camelCase, PascalCase, dot.notation‚Ä¶), match your framework (React, Tailwind, or plain CSS), and get tokens you can actually use.


Includes:

‚úÖ Linear & radial gradients (with angles)

‚úÖ Shadow exports (drop & inner)

‚úÖ Format-ready for Tailwind, JSON, and SCSS

‚úÖ Works great with Style Dictionary or custom configs


Perfect for design system handoffs, developer styling, and anyone who‚Äôs tired of manually formatting hex codes.
plugins.tagline: Export design tokens from Figma ‚Äî with naming styles, framework formats, gradients & shadows.

138641.name: Token Exporter Pro
138641.description:
Export Figma color, gradient, and shadow tokens with one click ‚Äî no fluff, just clean, dev-ready output.


Choose your naming convention (camelCase, PascalCase, dot.notation‚Ä¶), match your framework (React, Tailwind, or plain CSS), and get tokens you can actually use.


Includes:

‚úÖ Linear & radial gradients (with angles)

‚úÖ Shadow exports (drop & inner)

‚úÖ Format-ready for Tailwind, JSON, and SCSS

plugins.name: Invoicely
plugins.description:
Create clean, professional invoices directly inside Figma ‚Äî no extra tools needed.


Invoicely lets freelancers, designers, and agencies generate stylish invoices in seconds with pre-built templates, client autofill.


‚ú¶ Select a template

‚ú¶ Add your client and items

‚ú¶ Hit ‚ÄúGenerate Invoice‚Äù ‚Äî done.


Built for speed. Designed for simplicity.

accepted.name: Diego Grillo
accepted.description:
I like building things that people use.
Mostly simple, useful, sometimes weird.
Currently shipping plugins, tools & ideas.

plugins.tagline: Quick Invoice Maker for Figma

137998.name: Invoicely
137998.description:

Invoicely lets freelancers, designers, and agencies generate stylish invoices in seconds with pre-built templates, client autofill.

Stay tuned for more features and improvements coming soon!

plugins.name: Rename by text list
plugins.description:
This plugin lets you rename multiple layers in bulk using a text-based list.

Simply select two Auto Layout frames:

  1. One containing the elements to rename (any layer type)
  2. One containing text nodes with the desired names

The plugin will rename each element in the first frame using the corresponding text content from the second frame, based on their order in the layers panel.
plugins.tagline: Rename one list of items by another list of text items

137516.name: Rename by text list
137516.description:

Simply select two Auto Layout frames:

  1. One containing the elements to rename (any layer type)
  2. One containing text nodes with the desired names

The plugin will rename each element in the first frame using the corresponding text content from the second frame, based on their order in the layers panel.
137516.tagline: Rename one list of items by another list of text items

plugins.name: Tint & Shade Generator
plugins.description:
Quickly generate a color palette from any given color directly inside Figma. Choose how many shades and tints you'd like to generate ‚Äî the plugin dynamically creates balanced variations optimized for both light and dark mode interfaces.


Each color swatch is clearly labeled for readability. Perfect for building design systems, theming user interfaces, or exploring creative color variations.


Simple, clean, and efficient ‚Äî made for everyday design workflows.
plugins.tagline: Generate a full color palette from any color with clear labels, supporting light and dark modes.

plugins.name: Tiny Exports
plugins.description:
Optimize your exported assets for web and mobile applications with just a few clicks.


Features

  1. Export layers with Figma‚Äôs export settings
  2. Support for layer naming conventions. Useful for setting exports in component libraries.
  3. Export individual layers or all at once
  4. Export only exportable layers under the current selection
  5. Support for TinyPNG compression (API key required) ‚Äì available for free
  6. WIP: Apply export settings automatically to all image layers
  7. WIP: Apply export settings to all manually selected layers


How to Use

  1. Set Figma‚Äôs export settings or use the naming convention `export-[scale]x-[format]` (e.g., `export-1.5x-png`).
  2. Trigger the plugin in Figma while in design mode.
  3. Get a TinyPNG API key from [tinypng.com/developers](https://tinypng.com/developers) and enter it in the plugin‚Äôs Settings tab.
  4. Enable TinyPNG compression for optimized images.
  5. Use the plugin UI to export individual layers or all at once.


Naming Convention

SVGs or PDFs do not support `scale`. If a naming convention is present, it is preferred over Figma's export settings. It is recommended to use Figma's export settings if you can.

  1. Format: `export-[scale]x-[format]`
  2. `scale`: Any number (e.g., 2, 1.5) ‚Äì 1 by default
  3. `format`: png, jpg, svg, or pdf ‚Äì jpg is set by default


Examples:

  1. `imageName [export-1.5x-png]`
  2. `imageName [export-2x-jpg]`
  3. `imageName [export-jpg]`
  4. `svgName [export-svg]`


Security

  1. The TinyPNG API key is stored only locally
  2. The plugin uses a proxy to communicate with the API


Known Issues

- Unable to export and set multiple exports from one layer
plugins.tagline: Easily export all layers with TinyPNG compression.

137400.name: Tiny Exports
137400.description:
Optimize your exported assets for web and mobile applications with just a few clicks.


Features

  1. Export layers with Figma‚Äôs export settings
  2. Support for layer naming conventions. Useful for setting exports in component libraries.
  3. Export individual layers or all at once
  4. Export only exportable layers under the current selection
  5. Support for TinyPNG compression (API key required) ‚Äì available for free
  6. WIP: Apply export settings automatically to all image layers
  7. WIP: Apply export settings to all manually selected layers


How to Use

  1. Set Figma‚Äôs export settings or use the naming convention `export-[scale]x-[format]` (e.g., `export-1.5x-png`).
  2. Trigger the plugin in Figma while in design mode.
  3. Get a TinyPNG API key from [tinypng.com/developers](https://tinypng.com/developers) and enter it in the plugin‚Äôs Settings tab.
  4. Enable TinyPNG compression for optimized images.
  5. Use the plugin UI to export individual layers or all at once.


Naming Convention

SVGs or PDFs do not support `scale`. If a naming convention is present, it is preferred over Figma's export settings. It is recommended to use Figma's export settings if you can.

  1. Format: `export-[scale]x-[format]`
  2. `scale`: Any number (e.g., 2, 1.5) ‚Äì 1 by default
  3. `format`: png, jpg, svg, or pdf ‚Äì jpg is set by default


Examples:

  1. `imageName [export-1.5x-png]`
  2. `imageName [export-2x-jpg]`
  3. `imageName [export-jpg]`
  4. `svgName [export-svg]`


Security

  1. The TinyPNG API key is stored only locally

Known Issues

- Unable to export and set multiple exports from one layer
137400.tagline: Easily export all layers with TinyPNG compression.

plugins.name: Export hide text
plugins.description:
Appends a suffix to the name of the copied frame. If left blank, "COPY" will be used.

Copies the selected frame, applies the suffix, and hides text and UI components meant to be hidden in the duplicate.
plugins.tagline: Make ecports wio

plugins.name: Human Design Map Builder
plugins.description:
This plugin is part of a structured system for generating personalized Human Design maps inside Figma.

It reads structured data from a frame called INPUT_PANEL and dynamically updates the cover, highlights centers, colors gates, and reveals matching sections based on the data.

It ends by copying all relevant sections to a target page (◊û◊§◊ï◊™ ◊û◊¢◊ï◊ì◊õ◊†◊ï◊™) for final output.

No data is sent to external services, except for a success/failure status posted to a webhook for internal workflow tracking.

This plugin is tailored for a specific document structure and may not function properly outside that context.
plugins.tagline: Automatically build and assemble custom sections inside your Figma based on predefined data fields.

137361.name: Human Design Map Builder
137361.description:
This plugin is part of a structured system for generating personalized Human Design maps inside Figma.

It reads structured data from a frame called INPUT_PANEL and dynamically updates the cover, highlights centers, colors gates, and reveals matching sections based on the data.

It ends by copying all relevant sections to a target page (◊û◊§◊ï◊™ ◊û◊¢◊ï◊ì◊õ◊†◊ï◊™) for final output.

No data is sent to external services, except for a success/failure status posted to a webhook for internal workflow tracking.

This plugin is tailored for a specific document structure and may not function properly outside that context.
137361.release_notes:
MAP BUILDER ‚Äì Version 1.1
Release Notes

Added secure status reporting using dynamic tokens pulled directly from the design panel.

Improved user feedback with clearer notifications throughout the map-building process.

Minor bug fixes and internal stability enhancements.
137361.tagline: Automatically build and assemble custom sections inside your Figma based on predefined data fields.

plugins.name: Button State Builder
plugins.description:
Button State Builder helps you create all interactive states (hover, pressed, disabled, & focused) from a single base button.‚Ä®Style your base button (colors, fonts, icons) however you like ‚Äî then run the plugin to automatically generate polished, accessible states.


To properly run the plugin, the button layout must include a state layer that accepts interactive color states.‚Ä®We recommend starting from a base button provided in the playground file.
plugins.tagline: Build perfect button states, effortlessly

plugins.name: Zephyr Export
plugins.description: Exports a section with all its images as an atlas to the Defold engine. Before exporting, it wraps images into frames, all existing frames into components, adds TYPE TYPE_BOX property to all components and sets constraints scale (scale is not set if stretch is set). After that you can use your components in the zephyr plugin
plugins.tagline: Figma to defold atlas exporter

135215.name: Zephyr Export
135215.description: Exports a section with all its images as an atlas to the Defold engine. Before exporting, it wraps images into frames, all existing frames into components, adds TYPE TYPE_BOX property to all components and sets constraints scale (scale is not set if stretch is set). After that you can use your components in the zephyr plugin

plugins.name: JSON to Variable
plugins.description:
You can import a JSON file to create grouped Figma variables. you can download the pre-structured Tailwind color palette JSON file via the link as a starting point:


Tailwind colors structured.json


The following is an example of a correctly formatted JSON:

[
{
"CollectionName": {
"modes": {
"ModeName": {
"GroupName": {
"Primary": {
"$value": "#FFFFFF",
"$type": "color"
},

"secondary": {
"$value": "#F5F5F5",
"$type": "color"
}
},
"GroupName2": {
"primary": {
"$value": "#2196F3",
"$type": "color"
}
}
}
}
}
}
]
plugins.tagline: Import JSON file to variable

135010.description:
You can import a JSON file to create grouped Figma variables. you can download the pre-structured Tailwind color palette JSON file via the link as a starting point:

"GroupName": {
"Primary": {
"$value": "#FFFFFF",
"$type": "color"
},

"secondary": {
"$value": "#F5F5F5",
"$type": "color"
}
},
"GroupName2": {
"primary": {
"$value": "#2196F3",
"$type": "color"
}
}
}
}
}
}
]

plugins.name: Nativ Localization
plugins.description: The Nativ Localization plugin allows you to adapt visual content inside Figma to any culture and language (from any culture or language). This includes context-aware translation of editable text inside visual assets, as well as uneditable text that are part of complex pixel arts. The plugin allows you to upload your own glossary enabling you to control translation styles/tones. The translations automatically maintain the same original style in the target culture/language. The plugin also goes beyond text, such as stylistically replacing country flags in a poster based on the localization target.
plugins.tagline: Transform visual assets to any culture and language.

135216.name: Nativ Localization

plugins.name: Name Shame
plugins.description:
Name Shame is a lovingly vibe-coded plugin born from one designer‚Äôs deep-seated frustration with default layer names like ‚ÄúRectangle 123‚Äù and ‚ÄúGroup 87.‚Äù Instead of silently suffering, I decided to roast my own poor file hygiene‚Äîand now yours too.


This plugin scans your Figma file for default-named layers, serves up a spicy roast for each offender, and lets you rename them with beautifully ridiculous alternatives like ‚Äúsuch_lazy‚Äù or ‚Äúidentity_crisis.‚Äù Use it for laughs, use it for cleanup, use it because your future self deserves better.


File hygiene matters. Might as well make it fun. üéâ

accepted.name: Aaron May
accepted.description:
Professional & Punchy
Creative Director with a love for design systems, clear UI, and a well-organized layer panel.

plugins.tagline: Scans bland layer names, dishes witty roasts and renames them with delightful absurdity

plugins.name: Bulk Certificate Generator / Generador Masivo de Certificados
plugins.description:
How does this plugin work?


Users can automate the creation of personalized certificates inside Figma, avoiding the manual copy-pasting of required data.



Step-by-step: How to use the plugin


1 - Create the base design in Figma

  1. Design a certificate inside a Frame or Component.
  2. Use text layers named like #NAME, #COURSE, #DATE, etc.
  3. These names will be automatically replaced with data from the Sheet.


2 ‚Äì Prepare the Google Sheet

  1. Create a public Google Sheet.
  2. In the first row, write the field names: NAME, COURSE, DATE, ID, etc.
  3. Fill the rows with each person‚Äôs data.
  4. Make sure the document is public (set to ‚ÄúAnyone with the link can view‚Äù).


3 ‚Äì Select your design in Figma

  1. Select the Frame or Component containing your base design.
  2. Only one selection is allowed when running the plugin.


4 ‚Äì Open the plugin

  1. Run the plugin from the Figma menu.
  2. Paste the Google Sheet link.
  3. Enter the sheet name (e.g., Students).
  4. Toggle the ‚ÄúShow ID‚Äù option on or off if you want to hide it.


5 ‚Äì Preview (optional)

  1. Click ‚ÄúPreview‚Äù to generate just one sample certificate.


6 ‚Äì Generate certificates

  1. Click ‚ÄúGenerate.‚Äù
  2. The plugin will clone your base design, replace the fields, and automatically arrange the certificates on the Figma page.


7 - Have fun!
plugins.tagline: Dise√±√° uno, gener√° cientos. Certificados personalizados en Figma desde un Google Sheet.

139581.name: Bulk Certificate Generator / Generador Masivo de Certificados
139581.description:

plugins.name: Random Rectangle Maker
plugins.description:
This plugin was made for testing purposes to test the cursor AI. I used Cursor AI to write the code and ChatGPT to help design the cover and icon. It‚Äôs a quick example of how fun and fast building with AI tools can be.


With one click, the plugin adds a rectangle to your canvas. Each rectangle shows up in a random spot with a random bright color.


‚Üí Made with the help of Cursor AI for coding

‚Üí Visuals created with ChatGPT

‚Üí Quick, simple, and fun to use

‚Üí A small tool for creative ideas


I really enjoy working where design and code come together. If you‚Äôre building something creative like a design tool, plugin, or even a storytelling project, I‚Äôd love to connect.


Reach out anytime: hey@abdulwahab.design

Or connect on LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/heyabdulwahab/

accepted.description:

plugins.name: push-my-icons
plugins.description:
Push your Figma SVG icons to GitHub with ease.


This plugin helps you

  1. Automatically extract SVG nodes
  2. Upload them to your GitHub repository
  3. Generate a pull request with added/updated/removed icons


How to Use

  1. Open the plugin and fill in the following fields:
  2. GitHub personal access token
  3. GitHub repository URL
  4. Target folder path in the repo (e.g., src/icons)
  5. Pull request title and description
  6. Select all frames that contain your SVG icon components.
  7. Each selected frame should be a top-level container for one or more SVGs.
  8. Click "Push" button.
  9. The plugin will:
  10. Export all SVGs found in the selected frames
  11. Upload them to the specified folder in your GitHub repo
  12. Create a pull request containing added, updated, or deleted icon files
plugins.tagline: Push selected Figma icons to GitHub in one click.

plugins.name: Frames to Pages
plugins.description:
‚ú® About the Plugin


Organize your Figma files more efficiently!


This plugin moves each selected frame into its own new page automatically, helping you:


  1. Improve performance on heavy files.
  2. Make navigation faster and more intuitive.
  3. Keep versions and project sections clearly separated.


Perfect for large projects, collaborative teams, and anyone who values a clean and structured workspace.


üí° Why use this plugin?


As Figma projects grow, pages often become crowded with dozens (or hundreds) of frames.

This can cause:


  1. Slower loading times.
  2. Harder navigation and confusion for new collaborators.
  3. Increased risk of overwriting or losing important work.


By splitting frames into separate pages, your file becomes lighter, faster, and easier to maintain.


üìö Common Use Cases


  1. Large projects: Quickly organize dozens of screens into individual pages.


  1. Version management: Save different design versions separately without cluttering a single page.


  1. Developer handoff: Share organized sections with developers more easily.


  1. Team collaboration: Help new team members find what they need faster.


üõ†Ô∏è How it works


  1. Select the frames you want to organize.
  2. Run the plugin.
  3. Choose whether to delete the original page or keep it.


Each selected frame will be placed into a brand new page, keeping its content intact.
plugins.tagline: Move each selected frame into its own new page automatically. Organize your Figma files easily.

plugins.name: Badenova Design System Sync
plugins.description:
This plugin synchronizes your Figma tokens with the Badenova Design System


Usage:

You need to provide a valid GitHub token to synchronize your Figma tokens.

To obtain a GitHub token, contact christoph.hummel@badenova.de or generate your own token.


If you have a valid GitHub token, enter it into the respective input field and press Save.

Then, click the Sync Badenova Design-Tokens button.

If the synchronization is successful, you will receive a confirmation message.
plugins.tagline: Synchronize your Figma tokens with the Badenova Design System
